Nice sequel to the first game, it's got deeper narrative and lot more puzzles. I enjoyed it a lot. It's an evergreen classic.

Edit after 3 years of completing the single player and the initial review: finally got the chance to play through the co-op with a friend. This game is awesome, and there's also many community chambers in the workshop that will basically give endless hours of gameplay and replay value. This game is still alive after more than 10 years.

Also there's plenty of quality single player conversion mods that gives you the opportunity to play brand a new campaign with newer puzzles and twists in the mechanics.

Overall I think this has to be one of the highest rated games on Steam, the best value for money due to the countless hours of gameplay and variety that it offers.
